Tyrael sighs deeply.

Tyrael: Like we needed that. We'll have to do this the hard way. Go 
and meet them please. I'll wait for Dread and Deathstar. What they 
bring could prove me wrong or right. I'll send you a message once I 
find that out. Go now!

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen <roborick007@y...> wrote:
> : : Darkangel : :
> 
> Angel nodds, then takes the nearest computer station. He tries to 
istablish a connection with the Predacon base. It fails. Another 
attempt wields the same result. Darkangel runs a scan, discovering 
the jamming field. He looks back to Tyrael.
> 
> Darkangel: Sir, we have a very serious problem. I've detected a 
global jamming field. All communications on the planet are being 
blocked!
> 
> 
> Nic <Proudwing500k@h...> wrote:
> Tyrael: I know that, but hopefully, the truce we hold with the 
Preds 
> will ease that up... a bit. Remember, do NOT mention Unicron.
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen <roborick007@y...> 
wrote:
> > : : Darkangel : :
> > 
> > Darkangel: So I'm to ask them to supply and combine their ships 
> weapons to this battery in a combined effort? Both sides will be 
> reluctant, but I shall try.
> > 
> > Angel waits to see if his commander has any more to say before he 
> follows his standing orders.
> > 
> > 
> > Nic <Proudwing500k@h...> wrote:
> > Tyrael: My plan is to build a giant artillery battery in order to 
> > greet our moon-sized friend... Contact the Predacons, then the 
> > Maximals. Do not talk about Unicron. If they ask for motives... 
> make 
> > up an excuse.
> > 
> > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen <roborick007@y...> 
> wrote:
> > > : : Darkangel : :
> > > 
> > > Darkangel: The weapon systems on our ship, as well as the 
> Maximals, 
> > is fully operational. We have no information on the status of the 
> > Predacons.
> > > 
> > > 
> > > Nic <Proudwing500k@h...> wrote:
> > > Tyrael: So do we. What is the current known weaponry of our 
ship, 
> > the 
> > > pred base and the maximal base?
> > > 
> > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen <roborick007@y...> 
> > wrote:
> > > > : : Darkangel : :
> > > > 
> > > > Darkangel: Some kind of preperation is going on. He needs 
> > something 
> > > done before he can come here.
> > > > 
> > > > 
> > > > Nic <Proudwing500k@h...> wrote:
> > > > Tyrael: I just don't understand... If they are here, why is 
> > Unicron 
> > > > not even near? Why send pawns?
> > > > 
> > > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen 
<roborick007@y...> 
> > > wrote:
> > > > > : : Darkangel : :
> > > > > 
> > > > > Darkangel nodded, but inside he feared the worst. By 
Primus, 
> > > > Unicron was coming!
> > > > > 
> > > > > 
> > > > > Nic <Proudwing500k@h...> wrote:
> > > > > Tyrael: I have no proof of that, but these minions... 
They're 
> > not 
> > > > > like Galvatron of any other he made during the Great Wars. 
> They 
> > > are 
> > > > > made out of him, I think, since they have the same energy 
> > > signature 
> > > > > as that found all over Cybertron when he was defeated.
> > > > > 
> > > > > He remained silent.
> > > > > 
> > > > > Tyrael: It could be that these minions are only here to 
> > replenish 
> > > > > forces. Let's hope for that...
> > > > > 
> > > > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen 
> <roborick007@y...> 
> > > > wrote:
> > > > > > : : Darkangel : :
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > Angel's optics grew wide at the mention of the chaos 
> bringer. 
> > > > That 
> > > > > was what Tyrael had been talking about on the bridge. Could 
> he 
> > be 
> > > > > right?
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > Darkangel: You think that these bots serve him and have 
> come 
> > to 
> > > > > prepare for him? Minions like Galvatron, Cyclonus, Scurge 
and 
> > the 
> > > > > sweeps once were. Unicron is coming... here!
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > Nic <Proudwing500k@h...> wrote:
> > > > > > Tyrael: Unicron... It was Unicron...
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > Four simple words, loaded with meaning. To Tyrael, it 
> spelled 
> > > > doom 
> > > > > > for this entire planet, notwithstanding his own plans.
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen 
> > <roborick007@y...> 
> > > > > wrote:
> > > > > > > : : Darkangel : :
> > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > Darkangel looks out a window at the landscape of Earth. 
> He 
> > > > sighs, 
> > > > > > thinking about the coming troubles.
> > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > Darkangel: This certinely changes the balance of 
things...
> > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > Nic <Proudwing500k@h...> wrote:
> > > > > > > Tyrael: You're right. And if now we are stuck with to 
of 
> > > them, 
> > > > > then 
> > > > > > > it can get worse... I hate this twist of events...
> > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen 
> > > <roborick007@y...> 
> > > > > > wrote:
> > > > > > > > : : Darkangel : :
> > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > Darkangel: I think we need to find out as much about 
> this 
> > > bot 
> > > > > as 
> > > > > > we 
> > > > > > > can, quickly. He's too strong for me to feel safe.
> > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > Nic <Proudwing500k@h...> wrote:
> > > > > > > > Tyrael was amazed. For a single bot to manage what he 
> > could 
> > > > not 
> > > > > > > do... 
> > > > > > > > impressive!
> > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > Tyrael: I am afraid I know nothing about this... 
> visitor 
> > of 
> > > > > > yours. 
> > > > > > > I 
> > > > > > > > will look at what I can do, then, if we need to do 
> > > something, 
> > > > I 
> > > > > > > will 
> > > > > > > > contact you.
> > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > He closed the line.
> > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > Tyrael: Your opinion, Darkangel?
> > > > > > > >

> > > > > > > > >

> > > > > any 
> > > > > > > > > register signature that I have... I wonder if you 
has 
> > > been

> > > > > > > > > too or if you have an idea what's going

> > I 
> > > > have 
> > > > > > the 
> > > > > > > > > feeling that something big and dangerous it's 
around"

> > voice 
> > > > > > boomed 
> > > > > > > in

> > > > > > > and

> > > > > > for

> > > in 
> > > > > > being

> > > > > > > > > > sub-commander. He winked at Dreadplague before 
she 
> > > left, 
> > > > > then 
> > > > > > > > > quickly 
> > > > > > > > > > followed Commander Tyrael.
> > > > > > > > > > >

> doom 
> > > for 
> > > > > us 
> > > > > > > all?

> > > > > > > > > > >

has 
> > come 
> > > > of 
> > > > > > him.
> > > > > > > > > > >

> > > starfighter 
> > > > > > mode, 
> > > > > > > > > > flying towards the unknown signatures.

fearsome 
> > to 
> > > > > speak 
> > > > > > of 
> > > > > > > > > here.

> the 
> > > > only 
> > > > > > one

> showed 
> > > > fear. 
> > > > > > The 
> > > > > > > > > Blue 
> > > > > > > > > > > Phoenix, afraid?!
> > > > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > > > Tyrael: Dreadplague, Deathstar, go investigate 
> the 
> > > two 
> > > > > > > > > signatures 
> > > > > > > > > > at 
> > > > > > > > > > > these coordinates. If they are hostiles, do NOT 
> > > engage. 
> > > > I 
> > > > > > > want 
> > > > > > > > > only 
> > > > > > > > > > > data for now. Darkangel, I need your assistance 
> and 
> > > > your 
> > > > > > > > advice. 
> > > > > > > > > > You 
> > > > > > > > > > > are now officially my Second in command. Follow 
> me 
> > > > please.
> > > > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > > > He left the room and went to the lab.

done.
